p: In Myanmar, climate extremes have increased in frequency and intensity in recent decades, and are resulting in impacts like soil erosion and soil fertility loss, declining water availability and decreased river flows, inland flooding, and above-average storm surges, among many others [ 27]. These impacts are augmented by existing environmental stresses; high deforestation rates in Myanmar, for example, increase flooding and water quality impacts in areas downstream during extreme storm events as flood and soil retention services are compromised [ 27].
